job.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
job.description: pGivewith is seeking a Full Stack Software Engineer to join our growing engineering team As an early stage team member you will be able to grow your skills and career by having significant responsibility in the development of the Givewith technology platform You are seeking a growth oriented opportunity and the ability to develop an industrychanging socially impactful global SaaS platform As a full stack developer you enjoy working on both frontend and backend technologies and are able to contribute to codebases anywhere in the development process from writing tests to deploying infrastructure You will get handson production experience on a wide variety of technologies and you will be able to develop expertise in areas that are both interesting to you and valuable to the platform while helping to create meaningful social impact in the real world You are a contributor to engineering organizational culture and want to be a key stakeholder in the expansion of a new engineering organizationppbrppstrongResponsibilitiesstrongpulliBe a key early contributor to our growing codebaseliliPartner with the engineering and product organization to plan and prepare for new features and enhancements for our technical and product roadmapliliMaintain and improve existing systems work closely and iterate quickly with product development to adapt to opportunities architect design build and deploy new featuresliliDesign and scale systems that collect store and transform data from various external sourcesliliSupport our Agile processes to build a highquality product development lifecycle and organized thoughtful team cultureliliWork with nontechnical stakeholders to define and build new featuresliullibrlipstrongQualificationsstrongpulliProfessional experience as a software developerliliStrong ability in Python and JavaScriptliliFamiliarity with Agile processes version control Git automated testing AWSCloudliliThe ability to work collaboratively or independentlyliliThe ability to communicate clearly with nontechnical business leadershipliulpbrp
